verbose_text: Knockdown of the components of pericentriolar satellites (e.g., BBS4), or reduced transport of pericentriolar satellites to the centrosome (e.g., p50-dynamitin overexpression), have been shown to result in reduced stability of the association of polymerised MTs with the centrosome, and dissociation of the MT network from the centrosome, without altering MT regrowth.
